intro: Mesechites oaxacanus, commonly known as the Oaxaca mesechites, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its hairy stems and palmate leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in moist, shaded environments. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
